text: was a Japanese mathematician who made the theory of complex analysis with several variables. Therefore, there are some theorems named after him in this field. ==Bibliography== * - Includes bibliographical references. * * ==Other websites== * *Oka library at NWU *Photos of Prof. Kiyoshi Oka Category:1901 births Category:1978 deaths Category:People from Osaka category:Japanese mathematicians Category:Kyoto University alumni Category:Kyoto University faculty
title: Kiyoshi Oka
